page.title: 05Valley and tourism
page.content: The attractive scenery of the valley and the 'olde worlde' nature of the village attracts many visitors every year. Many of the villagers take in visitors for bed and breakfast, and several of the houses are holiday homes. There is a youth hostel a little south of the village. Across the valley is Limefitt caravan and camping site. A popular site with many facilities, it has nevertheless aroused much controversy over the years, especially during its expanding phase early in the 7O's. Attempts to increase the capacity of the site were fought by the people of the valley, via public enquiries, but they were not successful. There is no doubt that, initially, the bigger site was a major eyesore in the open valley floor but screening has taken effect and opposition has died down.
